alert.note: Alert for Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 10:53PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Perry, southwestern Morgan and northwestern Athens Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1053 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Logan, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nelsonville, Glouster, Shawnee, Chauncey, New Straitsville, Corning, Buchtel, Jacksonville, Murray City, Trimble, Hemlock, Amesville, Rendville and Burr Oak State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
